body.p: Once on a time there was a woman who went out to hire a herdsman, and she met a bear.

p.dialogue: “Oh, I’m going out to hire a herdsman”, answered the woman.

dialogue.speaker: bear
dialogue.subject: woman
dialogue.fig_lang: “Why not have me for a herdsman?” said Bruin.

p.dialogue: “Well, why not?” said the woman. “If you only knew how to call the flock; just let me hear?”
“No, no! I won’t have you”, said the woman, as soon as she heard him say that, and off she went on her way.

body.p: So, when she had gone a bit further, she met a wolf.

p.dialogue: “Oh!” said she, “I’m going out to hire a herdsman.”

dialogue.speaker: wolf
dialogue.subject: woman
dialogue.fig_lang: “Why not have me for a herdsman?” said the Wolf.

p.dialogue: “Well, why not? if you can only call the flock; let me hear?” said she.
“No, no!” said the woman; “you’ll never do for me.”

body.p: Well, after she had gone a while longer, she met a fox.

p.dialogue: “Oh, I’m just going out to hire a herdsman”, said the woman.

dialogue.speaker: fox
dialogue.subject: woman
dialogue.fig_lang: “Why not have me for your herdsman?” asked the Fox.

p.dialogue: “Well, why not?” said she; “if you only knew how to call the flock; let me hear?”
“DIL-DAL-HOLOM”, sung out the Fox, in such a fine clear voice.
“Yes; I’ll have you for my herdsman”, said the woman; and so she set the Fox to herd her flock.

body.p: The first day the Fox was herdsman he ate up all the woman’s goats; the next day he made an end of all her sheep; and the third day he ate up all her kine. So, when he came home at even, the woman asked what he had done with all her flocks?

dialogue.speaker: fox
dialogue.subject: woman
dialogue.fig_lang: “Oh!” said the Fox, “their skulls are in the stream, and their bodies in the holt.”

body.p: Now, the Goody stood and churned when the fox said this, but she thought she might as well step out and see after her flock; and while she was away the Fox crept into the churn and ate up the cream. So when the Goody came back and saw that, she fell into such a rage, that she snatched up the little morsel of the cream that was left, and threw it at the fox as he ran off, so that he got a dab of it on the end of his tail, and that’s the reason why the fox has a white tip to his brush.
